name: Puyo Puyo
overview: Puyo Puyo is a puzzle game developed by Compile and was released for NEC PC-98 in 1993. Puyo Puyo belongs to the Puyo franchise. Puyo Puy, previously marketed under the name Puyo Pop in North America and Europe, is a Japanese series of tile-matching video games created by Compile. Sega has owned the franchise since 1998, with games after 2001 being developed by Sonic Team. Puyo Puyo was created as a spin-off franchise to Madō Monogatari, a series of first-person dungeon crawler RPGs by Compile.
